content.question: A sealed piston-cylinder assembly with cross-sectional area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is filled with a mixture of combustible fuel droplets and air. The piston has mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and has nonnegligible friction with the cylinder. When ignited, the fuel explodes into a gas with pressure <math alttext="P sub gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , pushing the piston upward. The forces acting on the piston are shown in the free-body diagram. Which of the following is a correct mathematical expression for the acceleration of the piston as it moves upward within the cylinder?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative F sub friction, end sub, plus P sub gas, end sub, times A minus F sub gravity, end sub, minus P sub atmosphere, end sub, times A and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>friction</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gas</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gravity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>atmosphere</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>/</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, the fraction P sub atmosphere, end sub, minus P sub gas over A, end fraction, plus F sub friction, end sub, plus F sub gravity, close parenthesis, and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>atmosphere</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gas</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>friction</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gravity</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>/</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative F sub friction, end sub, minus P sub atmosphere, end sub, times A plus F sub gravity, end sub, plus P sub gas, end sub times A, close parenthesis times m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>friction</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>atmosphere</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gravity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gas</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction P sub gas over A, end fraction minus F sub gravity, end sub, minus the fraction P sub atmosphere over A, end fraction, minus F sub friction, close parenthesis, times m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gas</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gravity</mtext></mrow></msub><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>atmosphere</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>friction</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative F sub friction, end sub, plus P sub gas, end sub, times A minus F sub gravity, end sub, minus P sub atmosphere, end sub, times A and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>friction</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gas</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>gravity</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>atmosphere</mtext></mrow></msub><mi>A</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>/</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
